lang.LATEX_TEXT: The equation for general relativity formulated by Albert Einstein. (LateX)
lang.ELEMENTSTEST_OPTION_STAGE2_FOUR: Determination of the concentration of a dissolved substance
lang.QUESTION1_STAGE1: How many moles are there in the final compound, taking into account that the amount of chloride-inois substance is equal to 3 moles?
lang.QUESTION2_STAGE1: Nitrate ions belong to which class of chemical ingredients
lang.QUESTION3_STAGE1: Choose the type of aquatic natural object that contains the largest amount of methane
lang.QUESTION1_STAGE2: Choose the ions that fall under the definition of 'heavy metals' from this list
lang.QUESTION2_STAGE2: According to this photo, visually determine what kind of substance it might be
lang.QUESTION3_STAGE2: Specify the methods of analysis that can be used to determine the content of sulfate ions in natural water
lang.QUESTION1_STAGE3: When quantifying fluorides through the calibration graph, the pF of the liquid under study is 3.4. Determine the concentration of fluorides
lang.QUESTION2_STAGE3: When determining the chemical consumption of oxygen, Kubel's method was used, the titrant is a 0.01N solution of potassium permanganate. Determine the content of CSC in 250 ml of the test sample in mg/ml, if 37 ml of potassium permanganate were used for the titration of the blank sample, and 53 ml for the titration of the test sample. the correction coefficient is equal to 1
lang.QUESTION3_STAGE3: Determine the total hardness of water, if 7.1 ml of 0.05n trilon B was used for the titration of 100 ml of solidified sample
